title: Spicy Olives in the Pan
introduction: Spicy Olives in the Pan, also known as Olive in Padella, is a flavorful and easy appetizer that calls for mildly flavored olives, such as Gaeta. This dish brings together the warmth of garlic, the heat of fresh green chile or crushed red pepper, and the freshness of cherry tomatoes and parsley, all cooked in rich olive oil.
ingredients: 1 fresh green chile, seeded and chopped, or 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper
instructions: In a small skillet, cook the garlic in the olive oil over medium heat, pressing it with the back of a wooden spoon until the garlic is lightly golden around the edges, about 2 minutes.
Add the olives, chile, and oregano. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes.
Stir in the tomatoes and cook 2 to 3 minutes more. Stir in the parsley. Let cool, then serve at room temperature.
